oai_dc:dc.dc:description: /kannan, who warned the people in vain of the approach of a Koranna war party, and was the only one who escaped. By /han=kasso (L VIII.-26. 8269-8285). A woman called |kannan sees a Koranna commando and returns home to warn her people. An old man insists that she has seen little ostriches and |kannan says she knows she has seen real people, but the people do not believe her. The Korannas attack them and |kannan alone survives the slaughter of her people. 1) p.8268v: |han=kass'o heard this from his mother (|xabbi-an), 2) p.8271v: the name of roots eaten by the |xam, 3) p.8279v: the name of |han=kass'o's black dog, 4) See 'Mountain Bushmen', 5) p.8281v: what the Korannas call the |xam and what the |xam call black people and Korannas, 6) See also The youth (of the Early Race of people) who warned those at home of the approach of a Koranna commando, 7) This story is found in Book VIII-26.
